column4: Has anybody managed to get skype working on a clean X64 install of 10.04
yes, basically just install their deb...
Tried, but says it need ia32libs which will not install on X64 system
: It says error Error: Cannot install 'lib32stdc++6' which then requires ia32-libs which also will not install on 64 bit systems
pastebin what you are doing and the full output please
click on skype-ubuntu-interprid_2.1.0.81-1_amd64.deb, then let deb installer run which gives  Error: Cannot install 'lib32stdc++6 which is a package it needs which is in ia-32-libs
type in a terminal: sudo apt-get install ia32-libs
have tried apt-get with IA32-libs. Does not install because it says it needs 6 other packages which are dependancies and which will not be installed either.
as I said, it works fine.  ia32-libs is a package for 64bit systems.  I'll be back in a bit, please *pastebin* what I asked
back, did I miss your pastebin?
pastebin /etc/apt/sources.list* and output of: apt-cache policy ia32-libs lib32gcc1 libc6-i386 lib32z1 lib32stdc++6 lib32asound2 lib32bz2-1.0 lib32ncurses5 lib32v4l-0
your versions seem outdated.  Run « sudo apt-get update » and then paste again
have run update just before I did these. Did it again and same results
use archive.ubuntu.com as your mirror then
